Title: DreamCodeVR: Towards Democratizing Behavior Design in Virtual Reality with Speech-Driven Programming
Abstract: virtual reality  vr  has revolutionized how we interact with digital worlds. however programming for vr remains a complex and challenging task requiring specialized skills and knowledge. powered by large language models  large language model  dreamcodevr is designed to assist users irrespective of their coding skills in crafting basic object behavior in vr environments by translating spoken language into code within an active application. this approach seeks to simplify the process of defining behaviors visual changes through speech. our preliminary user study indicated that the system‚äôs speech interface supports elementary programming tasks highlighting its potential to improve accessibility for users with varying technical skills. however it also uncovered a wide range of challenges and opportunities. in an extensive discussion we detail the system‚äôs strengths weaknesses and areas for future research.
